text:
(1)
Hotel Normandie just before it demolition, Broadway at S.E. corner of 38th Street.
December 21, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The Lefcourt-Normandie Building on the site of the Hotel Normandie, seen from the roof of the Metropolitan Opera House across the clearing on the N.E. corner, where the Knickerbocker Theatre has just been demolished.
March 26, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

March 26, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

Broadway, west side, from 40th to 38th Streets, with the Metropolitan Opera House, badly in need of a bath, in the centre. January 29, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Broadway, west side, from 38th to 39th Streets.
January 29, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, two years later, showing also 38th Street, south side, west from Broadway.
March 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same.
May 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

May 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The Knickerbocker Theatre, Broadway at the N.E. corner of 38th Street, shortly before its demolition.
August 18, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

Broadway, east side, at W. 38th Street, as viewed south- eastward from the 21 storied Times Square Trust Company Build- ing at the N.E. corner of Seventh Avenue and 40th Street. Shown is the excavation for the 35 storied Knickerbocker- Casino Building at the N.E. corner. Across same appears the towered 26 story structure (No. 1384-8 Broadway) on the former site of the Hotel Normandie. To the extreme left is the 33 story Bricken-Casino Building at the S.E. corner of 39th Street. The low roof tops seen in the center foreground are atop the Metropolitan Opera House. Note in the background the indistinct outline of the New York Life Insurance Company Building.

May 10, 1930.

P.L. Sperr

An earlier view of the same area prior to the erection of the Bricken-Casino (extreme left of No. 1) and the demolition for the Knickerbocker Casino. This view is from the opposite side of Seventh Avenue and shows on the left margin the photographers vantage for the later view.

February 4, 1929.

P.L. Sperr

Broadway, east side, at W. 38th Street, as viewed south- eastward from the 21 storied Times Square Trust Company Build- ing at the N.E. corner of Seventh Avenue and 40th Street. Shown is the excavation for the 35 storied Knickerbocker- Casino Building at the N.E. corner. Across same appears the towered 26 story structure (No. 1384-8 Broadway) on the former site of the Hotel Normandie. To the extreme left is the 33 story Bricken-Casino Building at the S.E. corner of 39th Street. The low roof tops seen in the center foreground are atop the Metropolitan Opera House. Note in the background the indistinct outline of the New York Life Insurance Company Building.

May 10, 1930.

P.L. Sperr

An earlier view of the same area prior to the erection of the Bricken-Casino (extreme left of No. 1) and the demolition for the Knickerbocker Casino. This view is from the opposite side of Seventh Avenue and shows on the left margin the photographers vantage for the later view.

February 4, 1929.

P.L. Sperr

1385-1391 Broadway, at the S.W. corner of West 38th Street. Structure shown, is the 23-story Bricken-B'way Building. Adjoining same and partially shown, is the Lefcourt State Building.

May 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr

Broadway, east side, from 40th to 38th Streets. The Lefcourt-Manhattan Building is in the centre, and at the right is the clearing on the site of the Casino and Knickerbocker Theatres.
May 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Broadway, west side, from 38th to 39th Streets, seen across the excavation on the site of the Knickerbocker and Casino theatres.
March 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same.
March 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Broadway, west side, from 38th to 39th Streets, seen across the excavation on the site of the Knickerbocker and Casino theatres.
March 10, 1930.

(2)

March 10, 1930.

The clearing after the demolition of the Knickerbocker and Casino Theatres, Broadway, east side, from 38th to 39th Streets. May 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

144-156 West 38th Street, south side, from west of Broadway to the corner of Seventh Avenue.

May 31, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Broadway, east side, from 39th to 38th Streets. At the extreme left is the Lefcourt-Manhattan Building. In the centre are the Bricken-Casino and the Knickerbocker buildings, on the site of the Casino and Knickerbocker theatres. At the extreme right is the Lefcourt-Normandie Building, on the site of the old Hotel Normandie.

1931.

Wurts Brothers.

Broadway, west side, north from and including 38th Street.
In the centre background, from 39th to 40th Streets, is the Metropolitan Opera House. Beyond the Metropolitan is the twelve-story Emerson Building, and beyond that is the 33-story Bricken-Textile Building. Above this is the Times Building, and in the distance is the Hotel Astor.

July 10, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
